page.title: 03THE AMENITIES OF CADEBY
page.content:
The village has no shops or inns and since the beginning of 1985 has been deprived of its Post Office.
Morning coffee and afternoon tea facilities are available opposite the church at Jasmine Cottage.
Cadeby is serviced by a mobile greengrocer and fishmonger each week. The mobile library visits every fortnight and the Meals on Wheels service calls daily to one of the more elderley residents.
Concern is expressed by the older residents, the oldest of whom is ninety three years of age, who now have to travel into Market Bosworth to collect their pensions. The lack of an adequate bus service poses obvious problems.
